page.title: 12CONTRASTING LAND USES (2)
page.content: The two contrasting side of "Park Lug" described on page 11 are explained simply by the two different systems in use by the farmers. The land on the East side is farmed by small, local farmers whose families have long farmed in the area. They represent the traditional type of farming. On the west side of the Lug is a large farm which is operated on a large commercial scale with at least one other farm outside the area. It is managed not by a farmer but by a farm manager. The farming system is intensive and hedgerows and woodland are not economical in such a system. Livestock farming can be relaetively economically with small fields. This is not so for arable farms.
